subject: Issues with pedals and vam pro
description_text:
Hello,

Im folowing up on our conversation through amazon for order number:
 701-7115180-5540227.

To re-iterate the problem, i have simsonn plus x pedals and I just got the
van pro-s. The issue that I’m having is that when the vibration is
happening I get the brake loadcell to react and detect brake pressure while
I’m not touching the brakes. I have done testing to see if this is an EMI
issue and it doesn’t seem to be but maybe a loadcell issue? I have tested
the resistance of the different components with a multimeter and I don’t
see any resistance. Also I have grounded the control box to the brake or
the throttle pedal with no results since I don’t think it’s an EMI issue.

Here is a video showing the problem:
https://we.tl/t-m8Z6d9evKJ

I’m also attaching a few pictures to show the setup.

The power is grounded with the 3 prong connection, everything else is
grounded, I’m plugging the usb directly to the usb3.1 port on the computer,
no hubs, software is latest 2.1 i believe, and I isolated the vams from the
bracket with the red washers. So I followed all the instructions from our
conversation on Amazon. Please let me know what the issue is.

Thank you!

On Tue, Sep 16, 2025 at 10:26 PM support@simsonn.com

Hi Nemanja Stavrić,  I’ve reviewed the video you provided, and it’s confirmed that when the vibration intensity exceeds 50%, significant electromagnetic interference occurs, which affects the stability of the brake signal. Using nylon screws and nylon washers for electrical insulation during installation can effectively solve this issue. We recommend replacing metal screws with nylon ones to prevent vibration-induced current from interfering with the signal through metal conduction paths.
